title: Aeneid 2 594-603 - Venus to raging Aeneas - Set 1

content.question: "Nate, quis indomitas tantus dolor excitat iras? Quid furis? Aut quonam nostri tibi cura recessit? Non prius aspicies ubi fessum aetate parentem liqueris Anchisen, superet coniunxne Creusa 5Ascaniusque puer? Quos omnes undique Graiae circum errant acies et, ni mea cura resistat, iam flammae tulerint inimicus et hauserit ensis. Non tibi Tyndaridis facies invisa Lacaenae culpatusve Paris, divum inclementia, divum 10has evertit opes sternitque a culmine Troiam." Aeneid 2. 594-603 Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question. 1. In lines 1-5 (Nate . . . puer), which two Latin words mean that Aeneas cannot control his anger? 2. (A) Identify the one future tense verb in this passage and (B) identify its subject. 3. (A) What is the case of fessum (line 3) ? (B) Identify one word it modifies. 4. In lines 5-7 (Quos . . . ensis), which four Latin words can be translated as “the army surrounds them”? 5. In lines 5-7 (Quos . . . ensis), (A) identify the one present tense subjunctive verb and (B) explain why it is in the subjunctive mood. 6. (A) Identify one and only one literary device found in line 7 (iam . . . ensis) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it. 7. Which two Latin words are connected by the conjunction -ve (line 9) ? 8. In lines 8-10 (Non . . . Troiam), which two Latin words indicate what Venus says is to blame for the destruction of Troy? 9. (A) Identify which one of the three people named in lines 3-5 (Non . . . puer) dies in Book 2 and (B) briefly describe the unique circumstances of his or her death. Answer in 1-2 complete sentences.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
